alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:56AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CHEROKEE... SOUTHEASTERN MCMINN AND MONROE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 AM EDT... At 256 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Etowah, or 10 miles south of Madisonville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Madisonville, Etowah, Englewood, Vonore, Tellico Plains, Niota, Fort Loudon State Park, Coker Creek, and Tariffville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown.
